title: BBC Local Live: Leeds and West Yorkshire on Friday 14 October 2016 - BBC News
summary: news , sport , weather and travel updates will resume at 08:00 on monday .
man arrested on sus of murder after girl , 17 , dies in leeds .
city 's emergency services ' sirens 'should be limited ' .
teenager charged over leeds towpath sexual assaults .
sirens tested in calderdale as part of major flood exercise .

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's it from us for today and this week .
we 'll be back with more news , travel , weather and sport on monday from 08:00 .
but before i disappear into the big blue yonder , let 's look back at five things we 've found out today
see you next week !
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: west yorkshire 's weather : a cloudy and wet evening ahead
text: a rather cloudy evening , some showers redeveloping before they merge into longer spells of rain later , the heaviest and most persistent rain in the east .
a minimum temperature of about 9c ( 48f ) .
saturday will see a cloudy start with outbreaks of rain soon clearing north .
it will tend to brighten and feel a little milder .
a southerly breeze and a maximum temperature of about 15c ( 59 f ) .
author: Keeley Donovan
BBC Look North

documents.title: west yorkshire 's big conker clean-up
text: so that 's who 's always getting to them before me
# cleanleeds have been out working hard clearing # conkers in # colton # ls15

documents.title: bake off winner nadiya hussain signs deal with bbc
text: last year 's great british bake off winner , leeds 's very own nadiya hussain , has signed a deal to make the bbc her home .
it follows speculation that she could be involved in the great british bake off when the hit programme moves from bbc one to channel 4 .
hussain said she will now continue to make films for the one show and develop `` other exciting programme ideas '' .
the bbc said details of her new programmes would be announced `` in the near future '' .

documents.title: leeds group hold vigil for tragic gorilla harambe
text: a vigil will take place in leeds this month to remember a gorilla killed in controversial circumstances at an american zoo .
author: Yorkshire Evening Post

documents.title: electric cars set to get road priority in clean air zones
text: electric cars could be given priority at traffic lights and exempted from one-way systems , under new proposals for clean air zones which could come to leeds .
the government 's planned clean air zones are intended to encourage drivers to choose less-polluting electric cars .
proposed for five uk cities by 2020 , the clean air zones will also introduce restrictions on older , polluting commercial vehicles .
but aa president edmund king said drivers would be `` baffled '' by separate rules for electric cars .

documents.title: step closer for pay equality for female asda workers
text: almost 10,000 women working for leeds-based asda have won a step forward in their battle for equal pay .
an employment tribunal has ruled they can compare themselves to higher paid men who work at warehouses even though they mainly work on check-outs or shelf stacking .
the women feel they 're paid less than others , despite their roles being of equal value .
asda says it `` continued to strongly dispute the claims '' .

documents.title: travel update : friday afternoon delays on the buses
text: this kind of tweet is popping up somewhat regularly at the minute , but there you go .
welcome to friday rush hour
bradford update : services are currently facing delays of up to 30 mins due to congestion along the routes .
leeds update : services are currently running with delays of up to 35 mins due to congestion and roadworks along the routes .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: e-fit appeal following sexual assault in bradford
text: police investigating a sexual assault in bradford have released an e-fit image of a man they would like to trace .
the victim , a 23-year-old woman , was walking along baslow grove in heaton at about 20:45 on 20 september .
the attacker approached her from behind and pushed her to the floor .
he then touched the woman over her clothing before running off towards toller lane .
the suspect is described as asian , of slim build and about 5ft 8ins tall .
he was wearing a navy blue tracksuit with a hood which was up , and bottoms .

documents.title: derby county v leeds united preview
text: tomorrow , leeds united are away at derby county , kick off 's at 15:00 .
leeds united winger stuart dallas is doubtful with a thigh injury .
midfielder liam bridcutt remains sidelined with a foot injury , but full-back gaetano berardi ( hamstring ) is closing on a return to action .
meanwhile , head coach garry monk serves a one-match touchline ban .
match facts
author: BBC West Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: watch : huge flood exercise in calderdale
text: hundreds of people are taking part in a major training exercise in the calder valley today - as the district continues to recover from the christmas 2015 floods .
operation calderdale 16 is led by calderdale council and is aimed at testing the emergency services ' response if there 's a repeat of the deluge which wrecked homes and businesses .

documents.title: emergency sirens give impression bradford 'gripped by lawlessness ' - councillor
text: a senior councillor has said bradford 's emergency services should limit the use of sirens as they gave the impression of a city `` gripped by lawlessness '' .
we frequently see ambulances blasting sirens with no traffic in front of them , why do n't you just switch them off ?
it 's a noise pollution we do n't need as much of , there 's an awful lot of it .
it does n't present a good image of the city to people - subconsciously , people think , 'what a horrible place ' , and it is n't . ''
emergency services criticised his suggestion as `` misguided '' .
he is due to bring up the matter at a council meeting on tuesday , as first reported by the telegraph & argus

documents.title: bumper crop for thieves
text: we 've mentioned this before , but this just takes the biscuit .
thieves are going around stealing the front ends of cars , more specifically on vauxhall astras and corsas .
this theft happened in the kirklees area , and they did n't skimp in the amount of the car they took

documents.title: live : your chance to ask a bbc look north presenter some questions
text: ever wanted to ask a bbc look north presenter a question ?
well here 's your chance !
amy garcia is back on our screens from today , and she 's doing a live facebook session right now with harry gration .
check it out below

documents.title: west yorkshire 's weather : a cool afternoon , some bright spells
text: any showers will tend to fade and most places will enjoy a quiet , cool afternoon with some brightness .
a cool easterly breeze and a maximum temperature of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: tributes to well-known postman
text: tributes have been paid to a much-loved dad and postman of almost 30 years who has died suddenly .
author: Wakefield Express

documents.title: beeston murder investigation : community 's 'shock ' at 17-year-old 's death
text: police in leeds have launched a murder investigation after a 17-year-old girl was found fatally injured at a house in beeston in the early hours of this morning .
an 18-year-old man is in custody after the girl was discovered at an address in tempest road .
it 's a lovely community , we all get on together .
it 's a shock because this is not the norm . ''

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our leeds newsroom this lunchtime include :
author: BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: egg art on show in wakefield for world egg day
text: did you know it 's world egg day today ?
i 'll try not to make any eggcellent yokes about it .
but check out this item from wakefield museum , it 's an egg with a landscape painted on it by a ww1 soldier
egg painted with landscape scene by # ww1 soldier in king 's african rifles # worldeggday on display at # wakefield museum

documents.title: city 's emergency services ' sirens 'should be limited '
text: bradford 's emergency services should limit the use of sirens as they gave the impression of a city `` gripped by lawlessness '' , according to a senior councillor .
john pennington , deputy leader of the conservative group on bradford city council , said the sound was `` noise pollution '' and was getting worse .
he is due to bring up the matter at a council meeting on tuesday , as first reported by the telegraph & argus .
emergency services have criticised mr pennington 's suggestion as `` misguided '' .

documents.title: travel update : a1 northbound closed at scotch corner
text: one for a bit further afield , but worth knowing about .
there 's been an accident on the a1 northbound which has closed the road completely .
it 's up at scotch corner and involves a lorry , which as you can see is across both lanes .
there 's congestion to catterick south .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: in operation calderdale 16
text: here 's a little more from the major flood training exercise going on in calderdale today .
operation calderdale 16 is aimed at testing the area 's emergency services response to further flooding after the boxing day 2015 floods .
hundreds of people are taking part and this is a boat rescue scenario :
and i 'm not sure what 's going on here , but it looks like fun

documents.title: yorkshire on instagram
text: if you 're on instagram , why not follow us as we share some amazing images from around the region ?
just tag your images # bbcyorkshire to be featured .

documents.title: beeston murder investigation : forensic teams begin work
text: a 17-year-old girl has died after receiving serious injuries at a house in leeds .
emergency services were called to tempest road in beeston just after 05:00 this morning .
an 18-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder .
these are the latest from the scene

documents.title: watch : flood sirens tested in calderdale
text: now , that 's loud !
here 's what the flood sirens sound like in calderdale - the council and emergency services are testing them for any possible future flooding .
( make sure you have headphones plugged in for this , unless you want to put the wind up people )
flood siren tests now over .
thank you .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid # operationcdale16

documents.title: sirens to be tested in flooding exercise
text: as we were telling you earlier , there 's a big exercise in calderdale today to prepare for any future flooding in the area .
be warned that the flood sirens will be tested at 10:30 , so if you hear them , do n't panic !
we 're here in # sowerbybridge taking part in # operationcdale16 with our # flood barriers @ twitterid

documents.title: proposed boundary changes could 'weaken ' bradford
text: people in bradford have raised concerns the city could be weakened if proposed parliamentary boundary changes go through .

speakers at a public hearing in leeds , organised by the boundary commission , said they feared for the future of the bradford south seat - which would be abolished and merged into neighbouring constituencies for the next general election .
wibsey is a very large area , bradford south is geographically a quarter of the city , so it 's not a trivial thing to take a part of the city off , it 's a huge big deal .

documents.title: beeston murder : latest from the scene
text: a murder investigation is under way in leeds after a 17-year-old girl was discovered with serious injuries .
emergency services were called to tempest road in beeston shortly before 05:00 this morning .
these are the latest from the scene
the victim was taken to hospital but was pronounced dead a short time later .
an 18-year-old-man has been arrested on sus of murder and is in custody .

documents.title: travel update : one lane closed m1 northbound j40
text: yet more travel disruption this morning , this time in the m1 northbound between j40 ( a638 ossett ) and j41 ( a650 carrgate ) , because of a broken down vehicle .
traffic seems to be coping well in the area though
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: breakingteenager charged over towpath sexual assaults
text: a 16-year-old is due to appear in court today charged with sexual assaults on women on a canal towpath in leeds .
the teenager , from bramley , has been charged with two sexual assaults and an attempted sexual assault related to incidents on the leeds and liverpool canal at rodley on last saturday morning .
he is due to appear at leeds magistrates ' court this morning .

documents.title: murder investigation after 17-year-old girl dies
text: a murder investigation is underway in leeds after a 17-year-old girl died after receiving serious injuries .
this is the latest from the scene .
police were called to an address in tempest road in beeston , shortly before 05:00 following a call from the ambulance service .
the victim was taken to hospital but was pronounced dead a short time later .
an 18-year-old-man has been arrested on sus of murder and is in custody .

documents.title: your weather forecast
text: we 'll see a few heavy , persistent showers at times today across west yorkshire .
these are likely to ease throughout the afternoon , with a better chance of seeing sunny spells .
highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: travel update : lane blocked m62 westbound j25
text: yet more woe on the m62 this morning , this time westbound , there 's one lane blocked between j25 ( a644 brighouse ) and j24 ( a629 ainley top ) , because of a broken down vehicle .
traffic does appear to be coping ok with that though
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel update : cleared - accident m62 j26 eastbound
text: so the accident on the eastbound carriageway is now all moved out of the way , but watch out for lingering delays .
the vehicles involved in the collision on # m62 e/b j26-j27 have been moved from the carriageway and all lanes have re-opened .
delays remain .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: breakingmurder investigation after 17-year-old girl dies
text: a murder investigation has been launched after 17-year-old girl was found with serious injuries in leeds this morning .
officers were called to tempest road in beeston shortly before 05:00 this morning .
the victim was taken to hospital but was pronounced dead a short time later .
an 18-year-old-man has been arrested on sus of murder and is in custody .
we 'll bring you more as we get it .

documents.title: travel update : accident m62 eastbound j26-j27
text: it 's not a good end to the week on the m62 this morning .
we 've got two lanes blocked eastbound between j26 ( m606 chain bar ) and j27 ( m621 gildersome ) , because of an accident involving a lorry and a car .
this is just after j25

documents.title: attractions could see investment to boost profitability
text: the people running some of leeds ' best-loved visitor attractions want to give them a makeover so they can then make more money for the council .
senior councillors are to discuss plans to revamp tro world , the farm at temple newsham and lotherton hall 's bird garden .
they say that despite budget cuts it makes sense to upgrade the attractions .
a recent investment at tro world prompted a 45 % rise in visitors .
another of their ideas is to create a high-ropes adventure course called 'go ape ' at roundhay park .

documents.title: good morning
text: a happy friday to you all !
i 'll be here with you until 18:00 this evening .
during the course of today expect tears , cheers but sadly no beers .
we 'll be looking around the whole of west yorkshire to find out the things happening which matter to you .
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds
